1560245103_191qyhaRxXEx1bdtG65iQvFddtXBj.body:
As far as I know, you don't meant do modify the db directly using SQL. The sqLite db is more a handy way to read values stored in your data json and in your user jsons.
The intended way of 'write' data in your zite is somehow changing these jsons and sign/publish them again. The zeronet engine will then rebuild the DB and the data you have changed will be now there.
It's hard to explain because I don't really get it honestly ;) Just grab some code and read it!
